events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on May 9th involving their vehicle and another driver at an intersection.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial information about the vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was promptly assigned to handle the case and contacted the customer to explain next steps.
The claim was officially acknowledged and the customer received confirmation with the claim number and process details.
The customer was asked to submit photos of vehicle damage, police report, and a copy of their driving license for verification.
Customer uploaded the requested documents including police report and photos of damaged parts on the insurance portal.
The claims team began investigating the details of the accident to establish fault and evaluate the vehicle damage.
Investigation concluded with a determination that the other driver was at fault, supporting the customer's claim.
A settlement offer was made based on repair estimates and policy coverage, outlining payments for vehicle damages.
The customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the timely response and offered settlement terms.
The claim was approved after customer acceptance, confirming the insurance coverage will cover all approved damages.
Insurance payment was issued to the customerâ€™s account for the agreed repair costs of the vehicle collision damages.
The claim file was formally closed with all procedures completed and the customer notified of closure status.
The claim documents and notes were archived for record-keeping and future reference following the claim closure.
